https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/36096/ : SUCCESS
Again, why these api's are part of this commit? I think you need to rebase your commit on top of https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/39574.
I overloaded your APIs and made some minor changes to suit doPatch. These APIs have one more parameter than your API.  Parameter：“locationIndicatorActiveMap”.

This api is also defined at line 746 under namespace. Also why this api is part of this commit? It is already there in the commit implementing assembly.hpp.
I think you should rebase your commit on top of commit
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/39574
I overloaded your api(line746) and made some minor changes to suit doPatch. Here is one more parameter than line 746.  Parameter：“locationIndicatorActiveMap”.

So apart from api checkAssemblyInterface where actually setAssemblylocationIndicators is being called, all the intermediate api's in the route are overloaded just to carry the parameter "locationIndicatorActiveMap". 
If the above statement holds true, 
then instead of duplicating so much code for carrying parameter can we just modify the existing methods like getChassis, getAssembliesLinkedToChassis, checkAssemblyInterface  to carry a flag/indicator to suggest if it called via get or patch and variable "const crow::Request& req" as parameter so that if it is a patch call this extraction of data can take place at that point where actually "setAssemblylocationIndicators" is getting called?
Done. Thanks
Please include what Inventory is contained in this assembly and also capture the busctl get-property of the Led-Dbus object for a mapped Inventory item
Done
Please include what Inventory is contained in this assembly and also capture the busctl set-property of the Led-Dbus object for a mapped Inventory item
Done
I am a little confused why is LocationIndicatorActive tied to Decorator.Asset ..
Also getLocationIndicatorActive has aResp and objectPath.. where is this fitting into ?
Done. Moved getLocationIndicatorActive to another location.
don't we check for number of input data ?
We check in Line 653
const auto& ?
We can't use const hear, no matching function for call to 'readJson(const nlohmann::basic_json<>& ...
setLocationIndicatorActive ?
Done

hmm and we don't need Associations.Definitions ?.
 
I must say I am greatly confused by assemblies :)
Assmebly.Definitions is already getting checked at line 525. This method is just a re-check that what is mentioned in the Association.json is also implemented in the system.
Activate --> Active
Done
it needs to be getLocaionIndicatorActive. But if it's const here, how are we populating the value into this variable ?
I think this is just a flag to indicate that when doGet is called and when do Patch is getting called. I am ok with this being a const as this is not supposed to be modified later on.
Yes, Sunny is right.
h,, why is it referencing setLocationIndicatorActive ?
"setLocationIndicatorActive" is a flag, We need to use this flag to judge whether it is doget or dopatch（line 354）

hmm.. why is it referencing setLocationIndicatorActive directly ?.. don't we have anything else that is patchable ?

Also, we need to check the !readJson() and other usual checks that we do as part of PATCH

According to the schema， we don't have Other things that is patchable.
we check the !readJson() in line 252
Why comment it? Maybe you should rename function getLocationIndicatorActive to getAsseblyLocationIndicatorState?
Done, removed it.
I don't see any places where you modify it. It looks like it should be const&
This function is named checkAssemblyInterface it should not set anything.
Since the async function is used in bmcweb, So we need to put "set", "get" or a callback in the   checkAssemblyInterface.

Passing simple types as const& is less efficient. You pass more data and introduce indirection. Compiler usually have more ways to optimize something passed via copy it is safe to assume that if you pass small data via copy compiler will produce more efficient code.

Thanks, I understand what you said. 
In bmcweb, const& is more used in this case. I just want to keep the same style as the other code in bmcweb. If it has to be changed, please let me know. Thank you.
Ack

Hi @Abhishek Patel
CI fails because you overwrite the new code with the old code. 
Please don't do this again. If you want to use these commits, please pull them to the latest, and then push your own commit.
